Intervention: Patients undergo a surgical resection of the primary tumour with dissection of the axillary lymph nodes after evaluation of sentinel lymph nodes.
Dissection of axillary lymph nodes: Dissection of axillary lymph nodes
Patients undergo a surgical resection of the primary tumour without dissection of the axillary lymph nodes after evaluation of sentinel lymph nodes.
No dissection of axillary lymph nodes: conventional therapeutic surgery
Eligibility: - Clinical, mammographic, ultrasonic or pathological diagnosis of unicentric and unifocal breast carcinoma
Location of preoperative occult lesions, hook wire or other method of location required for non-palpable lesions
• Previous (preoperative) or planned (intraoperative) sentinel nodes biopsy is required
At least 1 micrometastatic (i.e. not more than 2 mm) sentinel lymph node without extracapsular extension
No clinical evidence of distant metastases
No suspicious manifestations of metastases that cannot be excluded by X-ray, MRI or scanner, including:
No Paget disease without invasive cancer
Estrogen receptor and known progesterone receptor
No other prior or concomitant malignancy except:
Skin cancer of basal or squamous cells
• Properly treated in situ carcinoma of the cervix
A properly treated melanoma in situ
A contralateral or in situ ipsilateral carcinoma of the breast
No psychiatric, addictive or other disorders that could compromise the ability to give informed consent
No previous systemic treatment for breast cancer
More than a year since previous chemopreventive agent
Results: ● Estimated percentage of live and disease-free patients at 5 years of randomization, where disease-free survival is defined as the time of randomization at the first evidence of invasive relapse at any site, second primary tumour (contralateral or non-brassial) or death.
Time frame: estimate of 5 years after median follow-up of 60 months
Description of the arm/group: Patients undergo a surgical resection of the primary tumour with dissection of the axillary lymph nodes after evaluation of sentinel lymph nodes.
Dissection of axillary lymph nodes: Dissection of axillary lymph nodes
Unit of measure: percentage of participants 84.4
Title of arm/group: No axillary dissection
Description of the arm/group: Patients undergo a surgical resection of the primary tumour without axillary dissection of the lymph nodes after sentinel evaluation of the lymph nodes.
No dissection of axillary lymph nodes: conventional therapeutic surgery
Unit of measure: percentage of participants 87.8
